courseSection0.text:
College of Arts and Humanities
English Department
Trevor Colbourn Hall (TCH) 250A
407-823-5596
english@ucf.edu
Department Chair: James Campbell
407-823-5596

Admission Requirements
None
Minor Requirements
None
Prerequisite Courses
None

courseSection1.text0: Select a total of twelve (12) hours. Additional courses not listed below may be substitute with prior approval from the Program Director.
courseSection1.text1: A list of approved restricted elective courses is found in the myKnight audit.
courseSection1.text2:
Technology and Applied Skills
CRW3713 - Writing for Video Games (3)
ENC4416 - Writing in Digital Environments (3)
ENG3817 - Digital Archives (3)
ENC4414 - Writing and Hypertext (3)
ENC4290 - Usability Testing for Technical Communication (3)
DIG3043 - Evolution of Video Games (3)
FIL4040 - Animation Film History for Non-Film Majors (3)
courseSection1.text3:
Theory and Critique
AMH4644 - Viewing American History in the Twentieth Century (3)
DIG3024 - Digital Cultures & Narrative (3)
ENC3417 - Literacy and Technology (3)
HIS4150 - History and Historians (3)
PHI3323 - Minds and Machines: Philosophy of Cognitive Science (3)
PHI3625 - Virtual Ethics (3)
PHI3626 - Advanced Ethics in Science and Technology (3)

li.A grade of \"C\" (2.0) or better is requ: A grade of "C" (2.0) or better is required in each course used to satisfy the minor
li.At least 12 hours used in the minor must: At least 12 hours used in the minor must be earned at UCF within the College of Arts and Humanities.
li.No credit by exam (TSD, Military credit): No credit by exam (TSD, Military credit) may be used.
li.Internship, Co-op, or Independent Study: Internship, Co-op, or Independent Study credit cannot be used toward the minor.

courseSection0.text:
Other Requirements

A grade of "C" (2.0) or better is required in each course used to satisfy the minor
At least 12 hours used in the minor must be earned at UCF within the College of Arts and Humanities.
No credit by exam (TSD, Military credit) may be used.
Internship, Co-op, or Independent Study credit cannot be used toward the minor.
